definition: monotone/only one ingredient/(mahjong) all in the same suit
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: There was a time when the only color in my closet was black.
sentences.chinese: 曾经有一段时间，我的衣柜里是清一色的黑色。

sentences.english: Leading the effort today are Western-oriented leaders who are almost uniformly young.
sentences.chinese: 现今领导群伦的都是清一色奉西方为圭臬的年轻人。

sentences.english: A female singing voice, but in fact came from a group of all-boys voice.
sentences.chinese: 歌声是女音，但实际上是出自一群清一色的男生嗓子。

sentences.english: In classical fairy tales, step-mothers always play an evil role.
sentences.chinese: 在古典童话里，继母几乎是清一色的坏蛋。

sentences.english: We are wearing white outfits in the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这个会议中穿清一色的的色工作装。

definition: for the most part/many/most/the greater part/mostly
for the most part/on the whole/also pr. [da4 du1]
for the most part/on the whole/metropolitan
Dadu, capital of China during the Yuan Dynasty (1280-1368), modern day Beijing
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
to be adjusted to uniformity (usually of weights and measures) (idiom)
fully armed/armed to the teeth/fig. fully equipped
